course_title: Communication Skills for Advanced Speakers I
class_notes:
(S/U Only)


Audience: International graduate students who speak English as a second or additional language at an advanced level (as determined by the ELSP assessment) 
Meeting times: Once per week for 75 minutes; day and time TBD based on enrolled participants' availability 
ELSP 517 is designed to help graduate students further advance their spoken communication skills in English in various academic and social settings. Participants in this course will practice communication strategies to participate fully and confidently in the following speech acts: small talk to build connections, delivering an engaging academic self-introduction, and participating in and leading group discussions related to participant-selected academic topics.  Participants receive extensive, individualized feedback designed to push their language skills to the next level.
Contact: Heather Boldt, hboldt@emory.edu, DIrector, LGS English Language Support Program
course_description: Advanced speakers (OPI level 3) can narrate and describe in the past, present, and future time frames in paragraph-length discourse. Although they may have varying degrees of fluency and accuracy, advanced speakers can convey their message without confusion and be understood by listeners not accustomed to ESL speakers. However, they may lack the language to discuss topics extensively, participate in formal and professional conversations, and consistently provide a structured argument in extended discourse. ELSP 517 is designed to improve the communication skills of advanced students.
